page.title: 07LANDSCAPE OF THE HARVEL AREA
page.content: This is an area of outstanding natural beauty and also part of the Green Belt. This means that there are restrictions to prevent the develop- ment of housing and alteration of land use. The scenery of these North Downs is beautiful with deep meandering villages, wooded hills, magnificient views and the steep escarpment of the hills to the south. The underlying rocks are of chalk, resulting in good land drainage with no rivers. There is clay overlying the chalk in some places making crop growing possible. Harvel has a picturesque pond with ducks. There are also ponds at Ham and Great Buckland Farms. Other ponds have been lost in the last 50 years because the installation of tapped water has precluded their use for watering livestock.
